com.ojcoleman.ahni.experiments
Class TMaze

java.lang.Object
  org.jgapcustomised.BulkFitnessFunction
      com.ojcoleman.ahni.evaluation.AHNIFitnessFunction
          com.ojcoleman.ahni.evaluation.BulkFitnessFunctionMT
              com.ojcoleman.ahni.experiments.TMaze
All Implemented Interfaces:
Configurable, java.io.Serializable
public class TMaze
extends BulkFitnessFunctionMT

Implements the T-maze navigation task, for example see: Sebastian Risi and Kenneth O. Stanley (2010) Indirectly Encoding Neural Plasticity as a Pattern of Local Rules. In: Proceedings of the 11th International Conference on Simulation of Adaptive Behavior (SAB 2010).

The input and output formats can be set to match the various schemes used by previous authors, and either a single or double T-maze can be specified.

See Also:
Serialized Form

REWARD_FAIL_RETURN_HOME

public static final java.lang.String REWARD_FAIL_RETURN_HOME
Reward value given upon failing to return home (used in fitness calculation). If this is set to 0 then the agent is not required to return home.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

DOUBLE_TMAZE

public static final java.lang.String DOUBLE_TMAZE
Set to "true" to specify a double T-maze.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

INPUT_TYPE

public static final java.lang.String INPUT_TYPE
Set to "range" to use range-finder type inputs indicating if walls are present to the left, right and forward, and a reward input. Set to "features" to use inputs that indicate the following conditions: turn required; maze end reached; home position reached; reward.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

OUTPUT_TYPE

public static final java.lang.String OUTPUT_TYPE
Set to "single" to use a single output to indicate the action to take next. Set to "multiple" to use three outputs to indicate which action to take next.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

initialiseEvaluation

public void initialiseEvaluation()
Description copied from class: BulkFitnessFunctionMT
If required, initialise data for the current evaluation run. This method is called at the beginning of BulkFitnessFunctionMT.evaluate(List). It should be overridden if data (eg input and/or output patterns) need to be set-up before every evaluation run.

Overrides:
initialiseEvaluation in class BulkFitnessFunctionMT

evaluate

protected double evaluate(Chromosome genotype,
                          Activator substrate,
                          int evalThreadIndex)
Description copied from class: BulkFitnessFunctionMT
Evaluate an individual genotype. This method is called from BulkFitnessFunctionMT.evaluate(List) and must be overridden in order to evaluate the genotypes.

Specified by:
evaluate in class BulkFitnessFunctionMT
Parameters:
genotype - the genotype being evaluated. This is not usually required but may be useful in some cases.
substrate - the phenotypic substrate of the genotype being evaluated.
evalThreadIndex - The index of the evaluator thread. This is not usually required but may be useful in some cases.
Returns:
The fitness value, in the range [0, 1]. Note that if novelty is the only objective then the returned value is ignored.

evaluate

public double evaluate(Chromosome genotype,
                       Activator substrate,
                       java.lang.String baseFileName,
                       boolean logText,
                       boolean logImage)
Description copied from class: BulkFitnessFunctionMT
This method may optionally be overridden to perform an evaluation of an individual genotype and output the results to a log. The evaluation is not used for any purpose other than generating a record of the evaluation of the given genotype. This implementation will generate images for the novelty archive(s) if possible. If called multiple times in the same generation it will only generate images the first time. If overridden, subclasses should call this method from their own implementation.

Overrides:
evaluate in class BulkFitnessFunctionMT
Parameters:
genotype - the genotype being evaluated. This is not usually required but may be useful in some cases.
substrate - the phenotypic substrate of the genotype being evaluated.
baseFileName - The base/prefix of the names of log file(s) that should be created.
logText - If true then text representations should be output.
logImage - If true then image representations should be output.
Returns:
A value in the range [0, 1].

getLayerDimensions

public int[] getLayerDimensions(int layer,
                                int totalLayerCount)
Description copied from class: AHNIFitnessFunction
Sub-classes may override this to return the dimensions of the given layer.

Overrides:
getLayerDimensions in class AHNIFitnessFunction
Parameters:
layer - The 0th based index of the layer to return the dimensions of.
totalLayerCount - The total number of layers in the substrate network. This can be used to determine, for example, if the output layer has been specified.
Returns:
The dimensions of the specified layer in the format [width, height] (0th index is width, 1st index is height). To specify a 1D layer or a layer that does not use a grid layout (see AHNIFitnessFunction.getNeuronPositions(int, int)) set the height to 1 and just specify the number of neurons in the layer via the "width". If the fitness function does not wish to define dimensions for the given layer then null may be returned. This default implementation returns null for all layers.

getNeuronPositions

public Point[] getNeuronPositions(int layer,
                                  int totalLayerCount)
Description copied from class: AHNIFitnessFunction
Sub-classes may override this to return the locations of neurons in the given layer.

Overrides:
getNeuronPositions in class AHNIFitnessFunction
Parameters:
layer - The 0th based index of the layer to return the neuron locations for.
totalLayerCount - The total number of layers in the substrate network. This can be used to determine, for example, if the output layer has been specified.
Returns:
The location of neurons in the specified layer. Coordinates should be supplied in the range [0, 1], HyperNEATTranscriber.RANGE_X and the corresponding Ranges for the x and y axes will be used to translate to the user specified coordinate ranges. If the layer is 2D then the locations should be specified in row packed order. If the fitness function does not wish to define neuron positions for the given layer then null may be returned. This default implementation returns null for all layers.
